name: up
description: Tool for writing command-line pipes with instant live preview

repo.name: up
repo.description: Ultimate Plumber is a tool for writing Linux pipes with instant live preview

readme.summary: The README provides a good introduction to the package, but lacks comprehensive documentation on configuration and troubleshooting.
readme.top_issue: Insufficient documentation on configuration options and troubleshooting common problems

injection_risks.description: The commandSubprocess is started with user-provided input (command) without proper validation or sanitization, which can lead to arbitrary command execution.
The shell variable is set based on the $SHELL environment variable or the -e flag, which could potentially be tampered with by an attacker.

critical_findings: Arbitrary command execution vulnerability due to lack of input validation and sanitization.
Potential denial-of-service attack due to large default input buffer size.
security.summary: The up package has several security concerns, including arbitrary command execution vulnerabilities and potential denial-of-service attacks, primarily due to inadequate input validation and sanitization.

common_complaints: enhancement requests for features like color support, tab completion, and history functionality
sentiment.summary: The community is engaged with both positive feedback and constructive suggestions, though there are ongoing enhancement requests.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are generally clear and patient, though could benefit from more technical depth in some areas.

concerns: No commits in the past six months
Low number of merged PRs in the past six months
No closed issues or releases in the past six months
positive_signals: Recent open issues and PRs indicate some level of activity
Five contributors have been active in the past six months
maintenance.summary: The package shows minimal maintenance with recent activity but lacks recent commits and merged PRs.
